title: 4th jab day.
body:
Had our 4th jab last Saturday.  All went
smoothly especially as my husband  was
in a wheelchair. Thank you. Mr and Mrs
Silk

title: Great practice very highly recommended
body: Farrow medical surgery is one of the best surgery’s in Bradford,after moving several GP surgery’s in the same area as I couldn’t even get through to the receptionist for an appointment so many people recommended farrow surgery and i couldn’t be happier because from the receptionist to the drs all the staff is absolutely brilliant if there was best surgery awards for patient care I would definitely nominate farrow as I am certain this surgery would win!for a patient like myself with complex health issues I had struggled to find a good medical practice which had a huge impact on my mental health till I came to farrow the receptionist are so kind and caring they actually answer calls and go out there way to help patients and so do the doctors especially DR R she is the most caring dr I’ve ever met who listens and genuinely cares and does everything possible to help so I would like to say a huge thank you to all the staff at farrow for  the Amazing work you are all doing!Anyone looking for a excellent GP practice farrow medical practice is highly highly recommended you will not be disappointed.

readBy.name: NHS Bradford District and Craven CCG

title: Knee inflammation
body: The physio who I saw was sympathetic and encouraging, with good, practical advice. He then introduced me to the sport’s physio, who was similarly helpful. He provided homework; I return to him in six weeks.

title: Great service and treatment
body:
I recently received care from the opthalmology department , both in the clinic and the urgent eye care.
I am very impressed and grateful for the care I received.
The Drs were courteous , kind and most importantly thorough .
I received excellent care on site and the subsequent  communication to my GP surgery was very speedy.
Whilst I have an ongoing problem I feel that I am in safe hands .
The nurses and technicians were friendly and efficient .
Many thanks to all concerned.

title: Appointments available
body:
Booked appointment by telephone no problems saw doctor following day 
Very helpfull. Had full consultation.

title: Difficult to get hold of.
body:
When you get to see them they are very helpful.
The process of contacting them is tortuous. When you ring you get 3 minutes of messages before you are told you are in a (long) queue.
I rang for an appointment recently and was told a doctor would ring back that morning. Receptionist asked which phone number to use - I said landline. Doctor rang at 5.30 and 7.30 on my mobile which was switched off.  Didn't get to speak to her.
Separately my wife received an email from the practice to book an appointment for a blood test. Aborted two calls to the practice when queues were six and nine. Third call from a queue of three took 17 minutes to answer.

title: Prepare to be on hold and chase repeatedly.
body:
In my experience if I call the practice I’m on hold for an average of 40mins. The shortest it’s ever been is 20mins but even then that’s good because on occasion it doesn’t ring seeming like the phone has been taken off the hook. 

I’ve been chasing a referral for chronic pain for almost 3months… - submit your request via the portal for it to be rejected. Submit another request via the portal and await a response in two weeks which will be you need a in person assessment. - no physical exam during the in person assessment but just told paper work is not on system. - Provide the paper work chase weekly & chased by reception still nothing! I’m sure there will also be a waiting list for the chronic pain clinic but thanks for prolonging my ordeal!

title: Do all the medics work part time now?
body:
I’ve been a patient at The Grove medical practice, previously called Cromwell Place, for many years and I’ve been very happy with the service provided, until recently.
The practice has changed so much since the new management has been in place and none of the changes have been for the better.
A recent experience, I was waiting for my wife, who was being treated at the surgery after an operation.  I was in the waiting room for almost an hour in mid morning, close to the reception desk, and, during that time, 1 patient came in who had an appointment with a GP and just 6 or 8, who had appointments with nurses.  There are 14 GPs and nurses shown on the website and I asked myself, what are they all doing for the rest of the time?  That question was reinforced in April, when I was asked to arrange a blood test.  The first appointment available was 8th June.
It’s like a different world at The Grove now, compared with a few years ago, when it was Cromwell Place Surgery.  It was probably the best practice in St Ives then but, according to all the patients I talk to, it’s now, arguably, the worst.

title: Disappointing!
body: Don’t listen to contact instructions on econsult form. Did a econsult form twice. Doctor was uncompassionate, blunt, boarding on rude! Was expecting to physically see a doctor, but this wasn’t offered!

title: Talking to Patients
body:
I recently had a small operation on my left ear.  When I attended the department for the biopsy the Dr and Nurse talked about the holidays as if we not it the room.  When it came to have the operation the same thing happened the Surgeon and Nurse talked to each other about what was going on in another Hospital once again as if I was not there.  Surely it is better practice to engage with the patient and talk to him or her as the case maybe.  Not quite what I would expect from Hospital Clinicians or Nursing staff.  Regards
John Tubbs

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Rude and not enough communication
body: Visit with a 15month old eye injury, not helpful or informative reception staff,not proper guidance,  wait 2-3 hours, no priory for babys

title: Amazing service
body: I have been given back my freedom by the cardiorthoracic team and E4 ward. I want to thank them for doing an amazing job for me, as a patient with anxiety, I felt very welcome and safe here at the hospital. Thank you Southampton, I never felt alone once.

title: Great friendly staff
body:
I came on this website to find out the address for my GP surgery. I am quite shocked to see bad reviews of this surgery.

I have been a patient for over a year and due to recent circumstances have been in contact with the surgery many times over the last year.

I have always found the reception staff and phone staff to be very friendly. I've always had a telephone appointment on the same day and been asked to come in when required. 

The phone staff are knowledgable and if they don't know an answer, they will find out and get back to you.

Without doubt the best doctors surgery that me and my family have ever been signed up to.

title: Friendly
body:
Polite staff, respectful of privacy, helpful.
Telephone consultation was on time, repeat prescriptions ready on time.

title: Excellent service
body: My family and I have been registered with St Peter’s Medical Centre for nearly 24 years. We’ve always had a positive experience. Polite and helpful reception staff with caring nurses and medical doctors. I can’t praise them highly enough.

title: Amazing, friendly practice
body:
Reception always answer the phone with a kind and friendly voice, genuinely sound happy to help and will answer any questions they can. 
I've never felt rushed during any appointments and always feel listened to. 
Overall a really friendly and helpful team that make the experience feel personal to you.

title: Well cared for
body:
The practice is pro active in helping me to manage my long term conditions.
My GP and nurses are excellent. If I do need an e consult I have prompt responses.
The approach to person centred care and supporting self management is excellent.

title: Good practice
body: I prefer to use their econsultation service which I find (for me) is really good. The experience of using it so far has been very positive. A diagnosis, based on the answers I give, is made. And medication, if needed, is prescribed. So far I'm happy with this surgery.

title: Good practice
body: Getting vaccinated was very good service and did not have to wait around.  Kept to appointment times.

title: Always Friendly
body: The practice staff are always friendly with me and I don’t feel nervous or stressed about going for appointments

title: Contacting Surgery needs improvement.
body: The Doctor was brilliant. He was helpful, polite and solved my issues. Trying to contact the surgery is always very difficult but when you do finally make contact, the receptionists try to be helpful.

title: Great surgery and lovely staff
body: Always quick to give us an appointment if we need one. Brilliant with our baby and caring and understanding. Fantastic midwife during my pregnancy and brilliant support since. Even the nurse who does our babies jabs somehow makes it seem like an enjoyable experience, she’s so lovely. Always explain the process of things and answer any questions we have as parents. Thank you.

title: Good doctors
body: Very kind and understanding when I attended feeling very unwell. Reassured me and followed up the next day with a phone call to see how I was!

title: Excellent Practice
body: Wonderful practice and staff in my experience.  I have read previous reviews and am so surprised. However I have also witnessed patients being very rude to staff. The telephones can be extremely busy and it can take some time to get through.  All in all though very happy with practice and service.

title: long wait in emergency
body: very bad that all have to wait in long que. only 1 nurse n 1 doctor moving around. nobody is ready to help. have been waiting for 4 hours and on top they r saying more 2 hrs i hv to wait. what kind of emergency is that

title: Disappointed and troubled
body:
I`m 55 years old and do not need the doctors very often, i phoned the doctors on Friday was put in a queue for 45 mins, once i got to speak to a person i was told there was no doctors appointments left, i explained what was wrong with me and got this response, if your that worried then go to A&E or phone back on Tuesday.
I would just like to say thank you for attitude toward me on the phone and for your non helpfully advice, which by the way did not need me going to A&E

title: Great emergency dental staff
body: Went in here for emergency dental work and couldn't be happier the staff where amazing with me and very friendly got my problem sorted out in no time and with very little pain would 100% recommend

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Feel very well supported
body: I've been a patient at Lisson Grove for over 30 years. as I'm getting older, I have used the service more in the last three years than ever before. I highly rate the E Consult service, simple to use, health professionals respond quickly and the quality of care remains very high.

readBy.name: Lisson Grove and Woolwell Medical Centre

title: Terrible patient care
body: Very disappointed with the surgery. Been registered for many years and this is simply the worst it has ever been. Impossible to get an appointment. Show very little compassion or care when you try to make an appointment. How is this allowed to continue?  Their system needs an urgent review so all patients can be treated as individuals. Very poor practice. How long will they be allowed to offload simple and easily managed requests to 111 when they can should be dealt with by a GP?

title: Awaiting 4th covid booster for 92 year old
body: A 92 year old lady is still awaiting a 4th booster. 2 of her Carers have been very ill with Covid-19. However, the Surgery - after waiting on the phone for 1 hour - say "You're on the list". What priority on 'the list' do vulnerable, disabled and immobile people on oxygen and in their 90s get for a booster at this surgery please? Due to the seriousness of the situation perhaps an ambulance with oxygen equipment should be used instead to travel to a drop in centre?

title: Excellent practice
body: I made appointment by telephone - did not have to wait long to be connected and the appointment available was fairly soon. I was seen promptly - no waiting. Staff very courteous, respectful & professional.  Doctors are up-to-date with recent developments and practice evidence based medicine. I have no reservation, whatsoever, in recommending this practice.

title: Children's A and E and Children's Ward
body: Huge thank yous to all in paediatric A and E and Children's Ward Bays 11 for looking after us with such compassion. We were made to feel welcome, reassured, genuinely cared for and were kept informed...not to mention the amazing cups of tea and hot chocolate and delicious toast. You must look after vast numbers of people each day and night, yet we were still made to feel  important. Really I can't thank you all enough.

title: Great Service
body:
Yesterday I took my elderly father to the practice after a telephone consultation. This was a short notice appointment which was offered to my Dad by his Doctor.

The Doctor was so kind & very respectful to my Dad. He gave hands on care himself and continues to give ongoing treatment. Being firm, fair and courteous to a gentleman of 89 years goes a long way. 

This is not the first experience of great health care from this Doctor within our family and hence it is only right to acknowledge this.

Thank you.

title: Excellent care
body: I have needed to attend Newton Abbot Community Hospital twice in the last 36 hours over a bank holiday. I have been extremely impressed with the service from receptionists through to a really excellent nurse. She showed complete understanding and was very professional, caring and also very friendly. I came away feeling I had received excellent care and after care advice. This is an excellent community facility.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

title: No proper queue management
body: I am having chest pain and visited to urgent care in early morning around  8 am.. they did ecg after 10 min but after that I have waited in hospital till 11.00 AM and then left, because they havent attended me till 3hrs and its pathetic service I have seen in my life... there was only 3 people  before me in urgent care for waiting for their turn around 8 am. Guys,No one willing to come hospital if they are well. So Doc and receptionist have to understand that we are in pain, is due to which only come to hospitals. Thanks

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Serene atmosphere
body: Visited for investigative tests. Hospital is exceptionally clean  and spacious. Parking easy. Staff were very kind and thoughtful to patients and relatives. Very reassuring in the way staff treat patients. Highly skilled.

title: Many Thanks to All the Staff, Nurses and Doctors
body:
On Friday the 29th of April 2022 I attended SpaMedica for a cataract replacement, I was slightly nervous, however the staff, nurses and doctors are very professional and reassuring and the two hours that I spent at SpaMedica was completely different than my appointments at “normal” NHS Hospitals.

The procedure was over in less than five minutes and was carried out by a skilled surgeon, and the rest of his team were polite and professional.

If I had one very small comment to make it would be: while you are waiting some music might help to reduce the trepidation that comes with surgery. However, overall the experience was above my expectations.

title: Review for pharmacy only
body: After a brilliant review I left a ref ward 9 I was given the all clear to be discharged at 7.45am yet it's now midday and I am being told I might have to wait until 2pm after a faultless care team pharmacy let them down. Very poor and due to their poor performance a much needed bed was taken up by myself for 6 hours longer than it needed to be

title: Amazing Service
body: My children were seen for a cardiology check up in the Children’s clinic on 29/04/22. The staff were very supportive and sympathetic to my very anxious daughter and after the appointment my daughter said to me how lovely you all were. Both my children were treated in a very caring, gentle manner and were very well looked after during the ECG and Ultrasound assessments.  Thank you for everything. You all do an amazing job!!

title: Great  young nurse
body:
I have been coming to see the nurse who is dressing my right bottom leg she is a great young nurse and has a lot of potential,
She has done a fantastic job on my leg as it was very blistered of which some ulcerated but now my leg is looking so much better than before and all thanks to this nurse,
I must admit it has been painful each time as she had to put silver patches on it,
And thought I might moan at her but I said no pain no gain
Thanks for what she has done

title: Great menopause hrt service
body: Pharmacy team at croft were exemplary this week, fully onboard with the (sometimes dismissed) need for hrt. My hrt was unavailable and they immediately reviewed my medication and sourced and arranged delivery to my home. As a single working mum this is brilliant. Well done

title: Great practice
body: Always on hand, very polite and helpful, just need extra staff to cover everywhere. Please bring back appointment systems online would be a great start to 2022 !!!

title: Caring and Compassionate Staff
body: After visiting based on 111 advice I cannot thank the staff in A&E enough. All very friendly, caring and helpful and wait time was under two hours from time of entering, to x-ray and treatment. Staff offered help, care and advice and the hospital was also absolutely spotless. Special mention to the nurses in the minor injury and fracture unit.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Service, Caring Staff
body: I have used this Dr’s now for many years and can honestly say how fantastic everyone is from reception to Dr’s, I have always received a warm caring welcome and with my latest medical scare I think that I honestly could not have been in safer hands! I have nothing but admiration and praise for the whole team! Thank you 😊

title: Speedy, friendly and professional
body: I had to visit minor injuries today and I am so very impressed and grateful for their treatment. I had an assessment, x-ray, reassessment and a boot fitted all within 40 minutes. Everyone we dealt with was very friendly and efficient. Thank you

title: Fabulous, professional, hard-working staff
body:
I attended SDEC daily for two weeks during April 2022 and found the staff to be friendly, great with empathy, professional and very hard-working, so I hope they realise that their work and high standards are very much appreciated. 
Also, considering that I could attend daily at my own convenient time, it's amazing that I was attended to so promptly, and I appreciate the fact that staff listened to and took on board my description of symptoms.
thanks- hugely.

title: Good practice
body: I have been a patient at this surgery for more that 20 years . The surgery has been clean and hygienic every time I have visited . During the Covid pandemic ,the I was able to access the surgery for vaccinations and repeat prescriptions. I must say that the doctors have been more than helpful in dealing with my various ailments. I have been a diabetic who has been looked after by wonderful staff at the surgery for several years. I have been regularly checked for blood pressure and for thyroid levels. Luckily I have never had a problem with seeking an appointment with the doctors.

title: Excellent supportive service.
body:
Having moved to Ellesmere just over a year ago I have unfortunately had a couple of serious health issues. I cannot praise the professional service I have received from  Churchmere surgery enough. From the practice staff through to the initial GP telephone consultation and in particular the GP who saw me in the surgery and who was excellent in supporting my patient choice for receiving heart surgery at an out of area hospital. I have also received great post surgery follow up and feel that the practice has provided me with the best of NHS care at what has been a truly testing time for primary care services. 
Thank you.

title: Fantastic service and care
body: Reception staff are kind and compassionate always trying their best to accommodate needs to the best of their ability with limited resources and staffing. The GP’s, nurse practitioners and other healthcare team are thorough, professional and kind - again with limited time and resources. One of the best GP practices I’ve been with and I’ve lived all over the country.

title: Impersonal practice
body:
No assessment for new patients. Very reliant on I T contact, e consult etc
Link to set up for repeats difficult and when unable to do ,your left with having to go to surgery and drop off request at the box. No help available to get system set up if alone and not IT literate your alone.Difficult to get anything sorted by telephone.

title: Staff are brilliant
body: Went to a&e even though they couldn’t tell me what was wrong with me, I have to say the staff were brilliant, they did give me a full mot sadly I came away not knowing why my knee and neck was swollen, but the staff was great

title: Excellent service
body: New to Rosegrove and registered with this practice. Excellent communication, always polite and helpful. Feel valued and cared for, unlike the large practice I used in Pendle.

title: worst of the worst
body:
this doctors is absolutely shocking, can never ever get in contact with them. They didnt give me my blood results for 2 weeks took me to ring and ask for them then they told me my bloods were irregular so they defo should have contacted me! 

Every single appoitment gets delayed and then they couldnt care less about you waiting. 

Every single person rings at 8am for appoitments , you spend 20 mjnutes on hold to be told theres none left. 

Theyl tell you there gonna ring u back certain time and day then just call whenever they fancy it! 

Couldnt recomend them any less.

title: Ward 17 is fabulous
body:
Can not thank the staff enough they was amazing with my little boy. The care and kindness they went above and beyond. 
Took there time and just made me and my 10 month old feel so safe.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Minor Injuries Unit opening times not correct on…
body: Why are the opening hours not correctly listed on the Wimborne Hospital Minor Injuries website? This is vital information that avoids the major AE department at Bournemouth hospital becoming overloaded. The website said on Sunday 24th April that the minor injuries unit was open until 8pm and we travelled from Verwood to find that it was closed. What a painful waste of time and petrol. I notice that the bank holiday opening times are not published for the 2nd May, the details are also not available on the answerphone. Surely directing patients to ring 111 just diverts them to an already overloaded system?

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible
body: Left me with extreme back pain with a history of a slipped disc and degenerative discs. Their treatment advice was to ring back again in a few days if I’m still in pain. Due to a lack of treatment I can no longer carry out every day tasks you know like walking.

title: Extremely Rude and Unprofessional Behaviour of…
body: I been there in Urgent Care Centre for treatment around 2:00AM. When I first called by the nurse for introduction, she was pretending Extremely Rude. She said “ Why you come this time for dressing, Why you didn’t come Day time, this and that” I tried to told her i haven’t any idea about this, I need urgent dressing that’s why I came this time. But she wasn’t ready to listen me even a single word which was really embarrassing moment for me as a patient. Then, after waiting for three hours, finally when Doctor call me for dressing, she was also very rude and unprofessional again. I asked her can you recommend me any moisture lotion for my skin, she asked go to pharmacy and asked them, what kind of this response is. Really disappointed with your staff behaviour. If they are working long day shifts then it’s not our problems. You must be kind and polite with  patients. “To get respect, you have to give respect “

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

author: decemberzx63
title: The telephone appointment I waited weeks for didn't take place.
body:
I have chronic migraine. My GP wouldn't renew my sickness certificate without a telephone appointment. As this was a "non-urgent appointment" I had to wait about three weeks for an appointment. On the day of the appointment I called to confirm that it would still go ahead, as I'd heard nothing all day. The Receptionist assured me the appointment was still open. However, the call never happened, and the surgery is now closed.  
A consultant neurologist agrees I have migraine, and discussed management options with me. There's little point though, I can't try adjustments to existing medication, or new medication, without my GP. If patients don't attend we receive warning letters from surgeries. Having waited weeks for an appointment, it doesn't feel good when I'm let down without any communication from the surgery or practitioner.

author: craterxt78
title: Looking after me so well
body:
Over the last 12 months I received amazing care from Ashfield Surgery, in particular Dr Vanam, Rachel and Charlotte. I have been in excruciating pain and they all did everything they could to help me as much as possible.  
I was seen quickly, referred me for tests fast and always responding to my concerns.I found Dr Vanam, Rachel and Charlotte to be really understanding and compassionate.  
I am grateful for the care at a difficult time.  
Thank you.

author: orangewc49
title: Patient journey from 111 call to discharge.
body: After a gallstones attack, which I had experienced several times in the past, I started to feel very unwell with fever like symptoms. I believed I needed urgent assessment so called 111. The call handler assessed me and talked to a nurse, but they only advised follow up by my GP. The nurse practitioner at the practice called a few hours later and sent me straight to Hairmyers for assessment. I believe 111 should have done this on the 1st call, as the extra hours may have been critical. I underwent several tests and was admitted for 3 days of IV antibiotics, given the severity of infection. The level of care in MAU, radiology, ward 4 and ward 8 was exceptional despite staff being very busy. The porter systems in place were fast and seamless and cleaning was being conducted thoroughly in all areas. Equipment needed was available at point of need and in good working order. The whole hospital was working in harmony. The only part which fell down is the time taken to dispense a prescription from the pharmacy. It took approx. 6 hrs. I believe I could have been discharged with this to be collected later to stop bed blocking. I hope that this feedback is useful.

author: aprilqb59
title: Myself
body: I've been trying to access mental health for eight months now. I was living on the streets homeless before that for years. I've been physically and racially abused during my life, as well since I was a child. I am now adult age. I'm struggling to cope. I have no family and no friends. I've worked here and there and I've been a full-time carer. I can't seem to receive support. I was bullied at school, bullied at work and experienced bullying on the streets as well.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: scopylhp141
title: 3 yearly cervical smear
body:
I received a letter inviting me for my cervical smear test at my local GP surgery, and was able to book the service within 7 days. There was no issue agreeing a date and time outside of my working hours, and the process was not embarrassing or intrusive.  
On the day of the procedure, the female clinician who performed the test was punctual and friendly. She explained what the test was looking for, what the possible results meant and how I would be contacted. She was incredibly communicative and went out of her way to make sure I understood and felt able to ask questions. The actual test itself was over very quickly, and my privacy and dignity were upheld without fuss. As a patient who has had multiple intimate examinations, this was exactly how I would want an appointment of this nature to proceed.

author: snowjn38
title: Great GP care
body: Hi there, I would just like to pass on a good story re GP treatment. GP surgeries are getting slated at the minute. After ongoing chest and cough issues, abx after abx I had telephone call from GP who asked me to attend surgery that day. Referred on for xray. Great service from reception (Noreen) and GPs (Dr Brennan and Dr Morris) within Diamond Medical Centre Magherafelt

author: GillyMeg
title: We couldn’t have asked for better care.
body:
My mum was discharged from hospital to Rosaburn House care home at the start of April. We only had two weeks with her there before she passed away but NHS Lanarkshire did all they could to discharge her to the care home to allow her to pass away in a non clinical environment with her own things around her. All the staff were fantastic. We viewed the home whilst mum was in hospital and David answered all our questions comfortably and reassured us that mum would be well looked after. We couldn’t have asked for better care.  
All staff took time to speak with us and treat mum like the Queen she was to us. Her oral hygiene was so important to her and us and her mouth and teeth were always fresh. She was on bed care the two weeks she was in and her nightwear always fresh and clean and her face cream and hand cream always applied. Her final days were precious to us and again the staff ensured mum was always freshened up and looked after the family so well. The nurses on day and night shift were amazing and kept us fully informed at all times. We have nothing but praise for Rosaburn and the team who work so hard.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: inspirejy87
title: Very welcoming
body:
I had my annual review with Stuart, he was very very welcoming with me, I enjoyed my chat with him, answered all my questions, which was alot,  
I would be more than happy see to Stuart again and again.

author: atlascf46
title: Well looked after
body: Very very satisfied and always well looked after in this surgery and I always try to see Nicky.

author: muscake37
title: Light atmosphere
body: Bloods taken for a child, not normally done. Child behaved amazing and I was treated very nicely, with a smile and made the atmosphere very light. Thanks for such an amazing experience for my son.

author: bravodt65
title: The best
body: In my opinion, this GP is the best.

author: eaterbh57
title: Very good
body: Very Good, but getting an appointment at the surgery is a nightmare.

author: woodpigeonyy33
title: Amazing, caring and fantastic!
body: I came for my baby's 2nd set of vaccines and saw the nurse - Nicky - and she was amazing, caring and fantastic!

author: dracoeh83
title: Efficient and experienced.
body:
Nicky is wonderful and always enjoyable to see her, she is efficient and very experienced.  
Thank you.

author: Nicola 64
title: Put at ease
body: I went to see Sue yesterday about my diabetes medication. She had lots of time and support for me as normal. She always makes me feel I can ask anything and puts me at ease. She is a credit to the doctor's practice.

title: Terrific department
body: The courtesy and professionalism of all staff, particularly the doctor who examined me, was terrific. I left the department confident that I had been diagnosed and treated with care and attention. Thank you all so much for being there.

title: Excellent care
body: Great practice. Since moving to this practice over three years ago I've always found it to be a massive improvement to my last practice. The staff are always helpful and I've seen three different doctors while there and they have all been very supportive. The phone lines are often busy but I always get a quick response on their online system. Recently I had a problem which I rang to request a face to face appointment for first thing in the morning and was seen the same day. Unfortunately the problem felt worse the next day and after calling the practice again, the doctor arranged for me to be admitted straight away, calling a registrar at the hospital with all of the details. I was then seen at hospital and home by the end of the day thanks to the quick action of the staff and doctor at this practice.

title: Wonderful service
body: Had my cataract done on right eye, everyone looked after me very well, I am really pleased with my eye and look forward to having the other one done, would recommend them, thank you.

title: Fantastic Service
body: I was called to have my 4th booster vacation on the 1st May 22. The service was well organised. I checked in and immediately off to see the doctor.  Everyone very welcoming.  A big thumbs up for what is an excellent GP practice.

title: COULD NOT ASK FOR MORE
body:
Think the title says it.
Our cousin was in and needed palliative care which was exceptional and could not have asked for more.
Now Mam is in 92 years old getting her nails painted.  Staff could not be more attentive.
We are more than pleased people like them exist and go over and above what they actually need to done.
Well done Team and Thankyou.

title: Eye cataract surgery
body: Preoperation and Operation experiences were excellent and efficient, with first class communication .

title: Super care by a great team
body: The care given was thorough and timely. The team were great, answering any questions and reassuring the whole way through. These services are under-pressure but you would not have known that from the care given; all staff were polite, helpful and caring. The investigations were thorough and the best care given. Thank you to all the team there.

title: Quick, high quality care from top doctors
body:
I was transferred to Royal London after a terrible accident left me with a broken back. I was operated on swiftly and with a top team of surgeons. They were very caring and explained everything to me before my operation and I felt very looked after and prioritised. 

I am grateful to everyone who looked after me, especially in this difficult time with the pandemic.

title: Great treatment
body:
I spent 3 weeks first in Critical care on 4th floor and then 1Oth floor. I was brought by ambulance after a fall.
I received excellent and kindly care from all the nursing staff.

title: Amazing staff
body:
I ' ve had an X-Ray. The appointment was late in the afternoon,  but staff had the kindness to call me ,telling that if I arrive earlier,they'll be able to take me in.
Exceptional and highly skilled staff,with amazing manners and approach.
The Receptionist was also  extremely kind ,whilst confirming my presence at the appointment, in computer.
It has been a pleasure to meet such kind and mannerly staff members.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor quality of care
body: My son attended a & e will a suspected heart condition. 5 abnormal ECGS and sent home, returned 5 days later via ambulance to be told he shouldn’t of been discharged in the first place! Again; was about to be sent home until I insisted a consultant review him he then had to be admitted due to his condition! Poor communication between staff I had to re explain to 4 Drs why we were here etc etc. who we big pack of reading of patients notes! Some of the nurses should not be aloud to work on a paeds ward! Didn’t even introduce themselves to my child, moody, didn’t check up on him, not very approachable atall!

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Awful practise
body: Impossible to get an appointment, they advised you to call 8 in the morning to secure one. Did this and then was advised to do the same the following day as the spaces had already been “filled up” had covid all I needed was to get a sick note. Reception staff are rude and patronising. Will be moving doctors

title: Great new nurse
body:
Really kind new nurse, who not only put me at ease but actually listened and helped me. 
Really informative and knowledgeable on my condition. I am very grateful for your help. Just wanted to relay my thanks

title: Good treatment
body: On the 23/04/22 at approximately 0830hrs , I had to take my son to Urgent Care after he returned from a trip to Nepal with a broken ankle . The triage nurse who dealt with us was brilliant and her care and attention made a tough time so much easier . I would like to thank her for her professionalism and sense of humour . Thanks again 🙏

title: Utter Shambles
body: I was told to come here by 111 as the wait would be shorter than York Hospital. It is currently 0620hrs. I have been waiting in A&E for 6 hours along with at least 5 other people. Several people have walked out. There has been no staff on for at least 2 hours. None of us know what is going on. The seats are really uncomfortable and the vending machines are touch and go, sometimes working, sometimes not. I hope I never have the misfortune to end up here again.

title: Chaos after a 6 month wait
body:
My letter stated the precise time to arrive, who I’d see and where.
When I arrived it was chaos. Apparently there was NO face to face appointments and only telephone consultations.
Staff I encountered.
1 very efficient porter spraying hands and ordering patients  in accordance with “policy”
There were 5 receptionists chatting and wondering what I was doing there.
7 nurses looking for something to do
8 patients
I was directed, not to cardiology but to Gastrointestinal Clinic to wait!
A very dishevelled,  flustered unprepared consultant arrived to see me. His appearance was anything but professional
He didn’t have my notes and couldn’t access anything on line. I had to tell him my medical history. 
After 6 months since my illness started surly most necessary tests would/should have been done but no, another two are needed. 
I went to UHND reluctantly because my request to go to another hospital was refused by my GP. I will now be having a second opinion at another hospital.
In my 50 years of nursing, I have worked in outpatients department at several hospitals. Usually 5/6/7 clinics usually running late in organised chaos. This was by comparison unbelievably bad,
Covid was blamed, what rubbish. Hospital staff should be leading the way back to normality recovering from the pandemic
Overall UHND outpatients is a disorganised shambolic waste of time and NHS resources

title: Appalling service
body: My elderly mother is a new patient and after 4 failed delivery attempts she still doesn't have her injections and has run out of her existing supply. The waiting times on the phone are a disgrace. This company should not be allowed to operate.

title: GPs good - admin not so good
body: Telephone system/reception unable often unable to cope with very long waits to be answered. Very unfair of other reviewers to generalise the attitude of the practice as uncaring etc. I have found the telephone receptionists and GPs to be always caring and helpful. However, the receptionists behind the glass at the new surgery seem cold and dismissive and, in my opinion unprofessional and don’t give a good impression of a good practice.

title: Could do better
body: Was told a call back was placed in the morning waiting all day so I called the surgery back and nothing was logged for the doctor, no confidentiality as the receptionist wanted to know everything regarding my issues , I know they are working hard but simple things become a stumbling block

title: Fantastic TEAM
body: Fantastic day care team and surgical team was well looked after arrived 07.30am discharged 16.15pm same day and during my time there someone of the team was nipping in and out of the 4 bed ward all the time.

title: Friendly service Endoscopy unit
body: I was put at ease as soon as I arrived at the centre. The nurse in the room introduced herself and spoke to me through the procedure. The procedure itself was extremely painful.  I had sedation and was also given gas and air.  My colon is very looped and the Doctor could not access my hepatic flexure dispute pushing my stomach and several attempts. I have a high pain threshold and have gone through several procedures but this experience, although did not last as long was as painful if not more than childbirth.  I don’t know if more pain relief could be offered especially as was actually shouting out in pain.  I was keen to get the procedure finished.  Retrospectively I should have asked the doctor to stop and asked for more pain relief.  I am not complaining but feel maybe it’s something that could be considered in the future.

title: A great service no matter how long the wait
body:
I recently had to attend A&E with my husband  on the advice of a nurse at the local g.p practice. He had been in a car accident (shunted from behind, nothing too horrendous) but he was left with shoulder,  neck pain and tingling. 
Anticipating a long wait, we arrived with plenty of drinks (and a good book,in my case). 
The sign outside said 4-6 hr wait...which we were not the least surprised by. So, we waited.  
Just over 2 hours later my husband had been thoroughly examined and sent home, having been referred for physio. No lasting damage or fractures. 
Yes, the a&E department was extremely busy but the staff were constantly in and out, calling people through. They were doing their very best. 
 
What upset me was the disgusting state of the waiting area where people had left their sandwich wrappers,  empty cups and all manner of crap, on the floor and the seats . There was a bin, not 10 ft away! 😐 
The NHS is under enough pressure without having to clean up your rubbish 🗑 
A big thank you to all the staff in the A&E department. I'm sure you don't get nearly enough thanks for all you do. 
Two hours of my life well spent and if it was 4 or 6 or more, I would still be grateful.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Appointment xray
body:
Received an appointment for a specific scan. However I had to wait my turn, ‘due to the service being busy’  No apology. 

I personally found this, rude and perceive that you have no respect or value of  my time. 

This is not an urgent care or emergency unit. Why book appointments on bank holidays and not honour the times? Instead of me having to wait in a que with other minor injuries?  Limiting seating which was all taken and having to stand  up for 30minutes.

title: personalised service
body: My family has been using this surgery since 2010 and have had nothing but good experiences.  Our GP has bent over backwards to make sure we have been taken care of and we have always been treated with respect by the reception.

title: Unprofessional Reception asisstant
body: I need urgent review of my medicine and I did not received the help I need on time. I do not use know how to use technology but they do not understand that. I feel let down by the surgery's receptionyst staff. Them are rude and not very friendly.

title: Cruel
body: 6 weeks ago my husband had a heart attack and received excellent care, 3 weeks ago he was unwell and we visited a & e I joined him in all departments. Today he’s unwell again and I drove him to a & e, I wasn’t allowed in apparently hospital policy is ‘patients only’.  How the hell can this be? How can they be so cruel? How can it depend on which staff are on duty that day to what ‘hospital policy’ is?  Today I am livid and heartbroken in equal measure not knowing how my husband is or even if I’ll see him again.

readBy.name: Calderdale and Huddersfield NHS Foundation Trust

title: Elective C Section .... Amazing experience
body:
Thank you to everyone on 28th April for our elective C section to deliver our baby boy.
From the midwives, anaesthetist, theatre staff, ward staff, students, we had the most amazing care throughout. I was terrified of having a planned C section (second after an emergency one at a different hospital years ago). From the moment I was on the ward prior to moment I left, the staff were amazing. In particular my theatre midwife and anaesthetist where phenomenal. They all put me at ease and talked about just about anything to keep me calm. All the staff made me laugh and and shed happy tears.
Love the fact that even with a C section that skin to skin contact is massively encouraged from the moment your baby is delivered. Allowed us to take pictures and had music on. Couldn't have wished for better aftercare also. You can tell that the team are stretched but that had no reflection on the care me and my received. Even with other patients being demanding and impolite at times, they continue with professionalism and support.
Thank you!!

title: Excellent customer Service receptionist team
body: The Reception staff, are thorough and helpful, and direct/ navigate you in the right way with queries. Polite and precise. It is significantly important to highlight excellence performance made by professional in this industry, and the receptionist team at this practice have definitely delivered hence the reason for my comments. Overly Satisfying to know that my GP surgery has such an excellent team highly recommended surgery.
